channel.title: Rooting my Droid X?
channel.description:
I am considering rooting my droid x. I am tired of the grey notification bar and the theme all together so I want to try something new. I have tried various launchers but they dont seem to meet my level of customization.
What are some of the other pros of rooting my device? Is it hard to install custom themes? Is it safe to root my droid x because of the efuse chip?

item.title: Rooting my Droid X?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Yeah I guess not, but I don’t even need to install a custom rom.

So now im rooted, bootstraped, and now I am doing the whole deoxed process so I can change the theme.

EDIT: well I loaded a custom rom anyways what the hell. Tranquility 3.6 has easy theming options so I chose that.

EDIT2: Well Tranquility 3.6 is the biggest piece of shit I have ever seen. It removed all my apps including droid x bootstrapper so now I cant get into CLock Work Recovery mode. Now I have to flash the original sfb onto my phone and start over. Fucking piece of shit rom.

Read full topic

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

That’s awesome, you still can’t install a custom kernel yet.

item.title: Rooting my Droid X?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

There is a way to load custom roms onto the droid x.

Droid Life – 19 Aug 10

Koush Releases DROID X Bootstrap, Allows Full Nandroid Backups...

The guy just never quits. Koush, whom you may know from ROM Manager, Cyanogen Mod, Clockwork Recovery, etc. just released what he's calling the Droid X Recovery Bootstrap app to the market which tricks/hacks/laughs at your phone in a way to allow you...

Read full topic

item.title: Rooting my Droid X?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It’s safe to root it, but I’m not sure how much customization can be done, since you can’t install a custom rom.
